column4: Is it just me or does it really take more than an hour to install ubuntu
And then after waiting an hour and a half I get an error message in which I have to do it all over again
Did you verify the image you downloaded via md5sum?
did you get that?
Download 11.04 for cd or usb, verify it's md5sum, boot and it make sure it works, then use the install function
Don't use windows
Install ubuntu alongside windows
Make sure to verify the md5sum of the image you download though
To be honest, I don;t care why your current method isn't working
Whatever you want
You can uninstall whatever you did first
If it's in a separate partition, just install over it
It all depends on your system
Then there is a bug or you did it wrong
Download the image, check the md5sum and burn it
The important part is the md5sum. Also, run the built-in cd checker when you first load it
Yes, when you first load the cd, press esc then get to the menu and run the cd checker
After you first boot the ubuntu live cd
There will be an icon of a running man and battery (at least that's what it looks like to me) and that's when you press Esc
But first, check the md5sum before you burn it
Chances are, the cd checker will pass without error if you checked the md5sum and using a good disc and burner
AFAICT, you're doing it wrong
AFAICT = As Far As I Can Tell
you there?
